Detailed Description

This packet is sent to the modules and/or servers that are interested in changes in traffic.

It is mainly the RouteModule:s that will get information like this!

Together with the costs in this packet also the corresponding node ID are supplied. So the costs should be treated as additional delays to the normal time-cost { for all connections that leads out from the given node!} In terms of the costs in the RouteModule the new cost for the connections will be #costC = costB + addCost#, where addCost# is the additional cost from this packet. TODO: Perhaps this packet should not have MAX_PACKET_SIZE allocated but instead reallocate upon necessity. Also rename the static constants so they look like constants.

After the normal header this packet contains {tabular}{lll} Pos & Size & \ 0 & 4 bytes & allCost, if this is larger than zero, the packet contains all the changes in this map, otherwise only the new changes \ 4 & 4 bytes & nbrCosts, the number of changes in the packet \ each cost & 4 bytes & the nodeID of the node to change \ each cost & 4 bytes & the cost to add (cost + costB = costC) \ {tabular}

Create a new packet with new costs for some of the StreetSegments.

Set the mapID to the given value.

Parameters:
mapID The mapID of all the items in this packet.
allCosts If > 0 the packet contains all existing extra costs, not just the new changes.

reqID The id of the request that will have this packet.
mapID The mapID of all the items in this packet.
allCosts If > 0 the packet contains all existing extra costs, not just the new changes.

bool UpdateTrafficCostRequestPacket::addCost (  uint32  nodeID,
uint32  additionalCost
) 
 

Add one new cost to this packet.

Parameters:
nodeID The ID of the node that have a new cost.
additionalCost The additional cost for node with ' ID == nodeID.
Returns:
True if the cost is added to the packet, false otherwise. False will for example be returned if the packet is full.

bool UpdateTrafficCostRequestPacket::allCosts (   )  const
 

Returns True if the packet contains all known disturbance costs.

If the packet contains updates the return value is false.

Returns:
True if the packet contain all costs on the map.

bool  lookupIP = false
)  const [virtual]
 

Dump the packet data to cout.

Parameters:
headerOnly If true dump only writes the packet header
do a dns lookup of the IP. Can be very time consuming if the IP is invalid.

Reimplemented from Packet.

bool UpdateTrafficCostRequestPacket::getCost (  uint32 &  nodeID,
uint32 &  addCost,
uint32  i
)  const
 

Get one cost, incluing the ID of the item with that cost.

Parameters:
nodeID Outparameter that is set to the ID of the node with cost number i.
addCost Outparameter that is set to the additional cost number i. This additional cost should be applied on all the connections that leads out from nodeID.
i The index of the cost to return. Valid values are 0 < i <= getNbrCosts().
Returns:
True if the outparameters are set, false otherwise.

Member Data Documentation

const uint32 UpdateTrafficCostRequestPacket::m_allcostspos [static, private]
 

The position of the allcost flag.

This field shows if the packet contains all trafficcosts on the map or if it only contains the most recent updates.
